category: Operations and service delivery; Hardware, software or communications equipment and facilities
name: Inconsistency between redundant copies
description: Where repository maintains multiple copies of archived information, one or more differs from peers.
notes:
- Does repository maintain multiple redundant copies of archived content?
- Does repository employ mechanisms to check for inconsistencies between multiple copies?
- Are policies and procedures in place to react to the discovery of such inconsistencies? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes: - Repository maintains three redundant copies of archived information, but random checksum comparisons reveal that one is different from its peers
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Record and compare checksum information corresponding to redundant packages on a regular basis
- Maintain system technologies and security to limit likelihood of data corruption or malfeasance In the event of risk’s execution:
- Conceive policies and procedures to react to the discovery of such inconsistencies – for instance, use an election system where the checksum values in the majority are assumed to be correct and the minority is/are disposed of and replaced
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
